Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: Fish7_2-3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trastevere resort for a week while visiting our daughter. Our room was spacious by European standards, very clean and convienent to public transportation. The train station from the airport was a short walk, with the tram and buses just across the street. Our morning breakfast was available even on those days that jet lag caused us to oversleep! The hosts were extremely friendly and helpful.There many restaurants and small cafes nearby.I would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Kerry G
Reviews.Content: Arriving very late to our hotel (around 3am), our host was generous, guided us straight to our room, and arranged for a later breakfast than usual. The second day as well, we checked out at least an hour late and had a nice late breakfast. I recommend, even though it is hard to find!

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: silviola86
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Trastevere resort 9 nights (and I wish I could have stayed more) Very nice atmosphere, super-clean, very friendly staff. The room is big, it has a tv, A/C, wireless internet, a fridge... breakfast is really good and various and "Italian style". As I said staff is superfirendly and they help you in every way they can (giving you maps, suggesting you where/when to go...) The B & B is situated close to Trastevere train station and at a walking distance (or at a tram distance if you do not want to walk a lot. The tram stop is just outside the hotel!) to all main attractions in Rome. moreover it is close to the area of trastevere where lots of restaurants are situated and to the famous open market of porta portese (held on sundays)! It is also situated close to a bank, supermarkets, hairdresser, restaurants...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Quick Trips or Train Connections”
Reviews.Author: williamguice
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. It was perfect for what we needed. Coming off of our cruise we trained back into Rome from Civitavecchia...a 30 minute trip on one train (from the port to Trastevere Station). Walk out the front door of the station; go through the parking lot; get to the sidewalk on your right and then walk up the street a bit and you are there. All in all I'd say it was 10 minutes from the train to the B&B doors. I appreciated RJS's review which let me know that the building could throw you a bit. The entrance is quite plain and as you are going up the small elevator if you didn't know, you might would be a bit unsure. Once you see the sign and enter the B&B though it is awesome. Very clean and the couple who were running it were very nice and helpful. Rooms are spacious, clean and yes...newly renovated with a modern feel. TV was great except for I never imagined it would be so hard to find soccer on TV in Europe. This could have been my fault as we were hardly in our room except for late at night :-) The air conditioner worked great; the bed was firm but I slept like a baby. Bathroom was small but not too small with great water pressure...Huge to me as I love showers. We really didn't eat breakfast but did enjoy some nice coffee. We felt very safe and welcomed. The B&B is perfect for getting quickly over into the quaint areas of Trastevere or the #8 tram literally right outside makes it very easy to get over into central Rome for sight seeing within 15 minutes. Don't forget though to check the tram times as we stayed out too late one night and got ourselves a nice little walk back. The location is also perfect for getting to the airport (FCO) as you simply walk back to Trastevere Rail Station and take the train directly to the airport (about 30 minutes). Very very easy...location plus reviews (and pictures...which are spot on) were why we picked the resort and the courtesy, cleanliness, and quality of the B&B were bonus for us. We would & hope to use the B&B again. Feel free to message me with questions. Peace ~

Reviews.Title: “I was well looked after, I highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: RJS1981
Reviews.Content: At first the place was hard to find, it is in an ugly brick building with only a small plaque outside indicating that you have the right building. You go up the front steps, turn right in the hallway and you'll find a small elevator (or staircase) at the end of the hallway. The B&B is on the third floor. I must admit given the age and condition of the rest of the building I wondered what I'd got myself into, however the rooms are fully renovated and stylish, my room had a modern ensuite. The rooms are clean. There is a fair bit of traffic noise so I recommend earplugs. The breakfast was great, and they make you a nice coffee if you ask! The hostess was incredibly kind and helpful, patient with all my questions, even escorting me to a local cafe around the corner and ensuring I was looked after by the staff. The bus stop around the corner takes you straight into Termini, and Trastevere Station is only a short walk away too. There is an internet cafe nextdoor as well. I thought the bed was a bit hard, but discovered that was the case with most beds in Italy! I am happy to recommend this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent rest for airport stays in rome”
Reviews.Author: rwein
Reviews.Content: Have a couple of hours to rest in Rome ? (between flights), get off the train before Termini - in "Trastevere" station( the trip is cheaper and faster). TRASTEVERE RESORT Is in front of the station. New and clean good bathrooms and shower . Available also for a couple of hours.(good tratoria -restorant in front of the station as well)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Gwencita
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Trastevere Resort with my partner for 3 days and our experience was great. It is not in central Trastevere, but it's just some tramways stops away from the city centre (and the bus H will leave you there directly from Termini station). It is originally a flat converted into a B&B. Our room was great and we had a nice terrace that was shared with other 2 rooms. The bed was very good, and even when the room was facing the street it was not noisy at all (well isolated with double glazing). The best part was the toilet, it could be the toilet of a high quality hotel. The breakfast was correct and the staff kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Marco is a sweetheart and was an excellent host.”
Reviews.Author: travelblood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome for our honeymoon and stayed in the Pantheon Suite for 3 nights. The room was extremely clean and spacious and Marco (who runs the B&B) was very sweet and made us feel very welcomed and comfortable during our stay. He even went out of his way to help us rent a car at the last minute on our last morning in Rome...which was a life saver! This B&B is in a safe neighborhood on the outskirts of Rome, but is a short train ride away from the heart of the city. Good Value.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: cocolica
Reviews.Content: it was a pleasant surprise what we find there because everything is new and clean, the breakfast was very tasty and the coffee marvelous..the location is very close to trastevere, the best place for eat in Rome and also near to Tevere river. 4 tram station to the city center and very close to trastevere train station which can help U to go to the seaside, half hour with train..U can ask everything and u will find a perfect explication from the girl who is in charge there and who is a very nice and charming young lady..it's quiet and the rooms are very spacious..

Reviews.Title: “Great basic B&B in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Murko
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own in October 2009 for 4 nights. I could not believe how clean the rooms were. The bed was comfortable. Everything was basic but really functional. Breakfast was basic (pastries, cereal, coffee and juice) but lovely and the girls running the B&B could not do enough for me. The B&B is located in a bizarre little building (with security entrance) in Trastevere but it was close to the train and tram and so functional for sight seeing. Trastevere itself is great for local food and is not too touristy. All in all I would definitely recomend this for affordable and clean accomodation in Roma - hard to find!

HotelInfo.Name: B & B Trastevere Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Trastevere, 259, 00153 Rome, Italy
